resources.string: The chosen projection, %s, needs to send your location to an external service for geocoding. This will only be done if you grant permission to do this if you click the below button.\nYou can disable the permission after granting it by tapping the small \"disable\" link below the projection name at the top of the screen.
\"Open Location Codes\" are an open specification by Google for coding short adresses, and are also known as \"Plus Codes\".
Coords needs access to your precise location and can\'t work otherwise. Please grant the permission:
Coords needs access to your fine location. Please grant the permission here:

This app requires access to your precise location. Approximate location access is not sufficient for this app, since it is not precise enough. Please grant permission to access the fine location below:
You have only granted access to your approximate location, but this app requires access to your precise location. Please upgrade to fine location access below:
what3words is a grid-based algorithm to assign three-word codes to grid tiles.
UTM is commonly used by emergency services in Europe. It consists of the Easting and Northing parts, as well as the zone, which is generally not required by the dispatchers.
